 Need Help? 
 
 
 A-Z Database List Full list of Databases the library subscribes to, including trial access. Go to A-Z List Connecting from Off Campus 
 
 There are many ways to connect to the library, but the best one for serious research is the GlobalProtect VPN client.  
 You will install an application onto your computer that will allow you to conduct research as if you were on campus.  
 
 Download and Install : Visit the  ITS Virtual Private Networking (VPN) - GlobalProtect Connection Installation Instructions  page  
 
 Connect :   
 
 Find the application on your computer and start it up 
 
 URL: campusvpn.ucr.edu 
	  
 Sign in: NetID and password 
	  
 Verify your identity using Multi-factor Authentication (MFA) 
	  
 Open any browser and use Library resources as you would on campus. 
 
   
 You will stay connected until you disconnect or until the server restarts.  
 Pin the GlobalProtect application somewhere easy to get to. 
 
 
 Connecting from Off Campus 
 Our LibGuide for in-depth instructions on remote access
